The Scriptures warn us of things about our leaders we can't see,


Preface‚Ä¶ concerning the Twelve Apostles of the Lamb...


Behold, vengeance cometh speedily upon the inhabitants of the earth...


And upon my house shall it begin...


First among those among you...who have professed to know my name and have not known me, and have blasphemed against me in the midst of my house...(D&C 112:24-26)


O my people, they who lead thee cause thee to error...(2 Nephi 13:12)


Let no man deceive you by any means...that man of sin be revealed, the son of perdition...


Who opposeth God...sitteth in the temple of God...(2 Thessalonians 2:3-4)



...until he be taken out of the way. (2 Thessalonians 2:7)


While that man, who was called of God and appointed...shall fall by the shaft of death, like as a tree that is smitten by the vivid shaft of lightning. (D&C 85:8)


...the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation...(2 Timothy 3:15)


If ye love me, keep my commandments.  (John 14:15)

text:
I read those very lines he quotes when I played Anti-Nephi-Lehi:

Now, to take those lines and make them true somehow.  Here‚Äôs the truth. 

IIIIII CAN‚ÄôT !!!!!!

But, God can, if we admit that we, of ourselves, are powerless over our rebellion. 

Only God has the power to CREATE that mighty change. And to RESTORE us to complete spiritual heath.

That is what he does, he creates and he restores. 

We must surrender ‚Ä¶

Stop trying to do it on our own.  It‚Äôs not will-power.  It‚Äôs god-power from surrendering (burying) our will.

Even Christ had to do this, and God helped him through The Atonement.  

Even Jesus himself was granted enabling power.  

Father, not mine, but thine will be done.  And an Angel came to strengthen him. 

‚Ä¶ to the care of God.

He cap‚Äôs with this.  One of my favorite scriptures:

The Lord requires the heart. 
And a willing mind.

Then HE takes care of the rest.  HE made the Anti-Nephi-Lehi‚Äôs strong. 

He can do the same for us ‚Ä¶
If we are willing ‚Ä¶
